com.novartis.opensource.yada.adaptor

Class Adaptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.novartis.opensource.yada.adaptor.Adaptor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FileSystemAdaptor, JDBCAdaptor, RESTAdaptor, SOAPAdaptor

    public abstract class Adaptor
extends Object
    The abstract Adaptor class is at the root of the package hierarchy. Adaptors serve three purposes:
    1. Conversion of stored queries containing YADA markup into executable code stripped of markup and wrapped or amended as needed
    2. Execution of queries
    3. Indexing of results into YADAQueryResult objects, for downstream conversion
    Subclasses of Adaptor provide techonology-specific and vendor-specific adaptations of these functions.
    Since:
    0.4.0.0
    Author:
    David Varon

      • execute

        public void execute(YADAQuery yq)
             throws YADAAdaptorExecutionException
        This is a stubbed method. Implementation required in non-abstract subclass
        Parameters:
        yq - the YADAQuery containing the code to execute
        Throws:
        YADAAdaptorExecutionException - if exception is thrown during query execution

      • build

        public String build(YADAQuery yq)
             throws YADAAdaptorException
        Parameters:
        yq - the YADAQuery from which to derive the source code and other metadata for contruction of an executable query
        Returns:
        executable code
        Throws:
        YADAAdaptorException - if exception is thrown while conforming code to executable state

      • resetCountParameter

        protected void resetCountParameter(YADAQuery yq)
        Sets the count parameter to false. Count of SOAP results is currently not supported.
        Parameters:
        yq - the query to which to apply the new settings
